How can I recover an identity in Verus using the command line?

You can recover an identity in Verus using the `recoveridentity` command. The basic syntax is:
```
verus recoveridentity '{"name" : "your_identity_name"}'
```
Replace `"your_identity_name"` with the actual name of the identity you want to recover.

Examples:
```bash
> verus recoveridentity '{"name" : "myname"}'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "recoveridentity", "params": ['{"name" : "myname"}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
